directions.dialogText: The best new ride at the variable amusement park is The Incrementor! However, each variable must have the right value to ride. Let's start by creating a variable called \`number\` and giving it a value of \`0\`.

levels.mission: Create a variable called \`number\` and give it a value of \`0\` to get it on the roller coaster.
levels.tools: \`number\`: a variable with a number value
levels.tips: Your code should look like this: \`var number = 0;\`

directions.dialogText: Now let's program a button that will add 1 to our \`number\`. Inside the \`{ }\`, write \`number += 1;\`. Run the code, then click the button until \`number\` reaches the right value to ride the roller coaster!

levels.mission: Inside the \`{ }\` after \`add1()\`, write \`number += 1;\` and run the code. Then click the button until \`number\` reaches the right value to ride the roller coaster!
levels.tools:
\`number\`: a variable with a number value

\`setButton(number, function)\`: sets function to button by number

directions.dialogText: Now let's add another button that will increment \`number\` by 2. Inside the \`add2()\` function, type \`number += 2;\`. Run your code and use the buttons to get the variable on the roller coaster!

levels.mission: Between the \`{ }\` in the \`add2()\` function, type \`number += 2;\`. Run your code and use the buttons to get the variable on the roller coaster!
levels.tools:
\`number\`: a variable with a number value

\`setButton(number, function)\`: sets function to button by number

directions.dialogText: Ok! Let's add one more button. We've started you off on line 15. After \`function \`, type \`add5(){}\`. Then between the \`{ }\`s, create a new line and type \`number +=5;\`. Then run your code and use the buttons to get the variable onto the ride!

levels.mission: After \`function \`, type \`add5(){}\`. Then between the \`{ }\`s, create a new line and type \`number +=5;\`. Then run your code and use the buttons.
levels.tools:
\`number\`: a variable with a number value

\`setButton(number, function)\`: sets function to button by number

quiz.text: Which choice below would create the variable \`fruit\` and give it a value of \`9\`?
If the variable \`brownies\` has a value of \`4\` and the variable \`cookies\` has a value of \`6\`, which choice below would have a value of \`10\`?
Which would make a variable \`doughnuts\` and give it a value of the sum of \`chocolate\` and \`sprinkles\`?
Which choice would give the variable \`number\` a value of \`12\`?

directions.dialogText: Now let's try some subtraction. We'll start by giving \`number\` a value of \`20\` so that we have a number big enough to subtract from.

levels.mission: Give \`number\` a value of \`20\` to get it on the roller coaster.
levels.tools:
\`number\`: a variable with a number value

\`setButton(number, function)\`: sets function to button by number
levels.tips: Your code should look like this: \`var number = 20;\`

directions.dialogText: Now let's program button 1 to subtract 1 from our \`number\`. Inside the \`{ }\`, write \`number -= 1;\`. Run the code, then click the button until \`number\` reaches the right value to ride the roller coaster!

levels.mission: Inside the \`{ }\` after \`subtract1()\`, write \`number -= 1;\` and run the code. Then click the button until \`number\` reaches the right value to ride the roller coaster!
levels.tools:
\`number\`: a variable with a number value

\`setButton(number, function)\`: sets function to button by number

directions.dialogText: Now let's add another button that will decrement \`number\` by 2. Inside the \`subtract2()\` function, type \`number -= 2;\`. Run your code and use the buttons to get the variable on the roller coaster!

levels.mission: Between the \`{ }\` in the \`subtract2()\` function, type \`number -= 2;\`. Run your code and use the buttons to get the variable on the roller coaster!
levels.tools:
\`number\`: a variable with a number value

\`setButton(number, function)\`: sets function to button by number

directions.dialogText: Ok! Let's add one more button. We've started you off on line 15. After \`function \`, type \`subtract5(){}\`. Then between the \`{ }\`s, create a new line and type \`number -= 5;\`. Then run your code and use the buttons to get the variable onto the ride!

levels.mission: After \`function \`, type \`subtract5(){}\`. Then between the \`{ }\`s, create a new line and type \`number -= 5;\`. Then run your code and use the buttons.
levels.tools:
\`number\`: a variable with a number value

\`setButton(number, function)\`: sets function to button by number
